content: mae flower shawl jessica weindl this shawl is named after my mother whose middle name was mae some years after she passed away i realized i still carried a lot of sadness and pain surrounding her life it was a cold spring that year and i would take long walks through fields that were only starting to show signs of life i had started knitting this shawl and by the time i finished crops had grown vineyards had sprung to life and and the fields were starting to fill with wildflowers in walking through the fields and watching spring take hold i felt some healing of this pain and was able to feel peace replace the grief and regret the flowers in the design represent hope that life blooms again and my mother s story isn t over we all face pain and loss in this life and in some small way i hope this shawl can help you also find peace and healing in whatever you are facing mae flower shawl finished measurements the last row of the lace border will be after blocking possible if you are on gauge if not and 63 x 13 5 158cm x 34cm you don t want a stressful game of yarn chicken simply start the bind off after row 28 of the lace border section this will only take away one row of lace materials needed yarn i used jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off lichen and lace in this pattern there is an explanation of 1 ply 100% superwash merino fingering the bind off at the end of the pattern but 100g/400yd 1 skein you can also find detailed instructions with colorway pressed flowers photos here https //knitty com/ total yardage needed 398yd issuefall09/featjssbo php the instructions explain how to bind off 1x1 ribbing so just skip processing the purl needles stitches us size 4 3 5mm circular needle abbreviations notions co cast on stitch markers k knit tapestry needle to weave in ends k2tog knit two stitches together kyok knit yo knit into the same stitch gauge l needle left needle 22 st and 19 row = 4 10cm in shawl p purl body pattern after blocking p2togtbl purl two together into the back loop r needle right needle notes rs right side there are two sections to this crescent st s stitch es shaped shawl one is a garter and flower ws wrong side stitch section of the body and the other is the lace border the lace border includes yo yarn over one row of a similar but smaller flower stitch than the body page 1 #maeflowershawl @figleaf_fiber mae flower shawl flower stitch work this stitch where it says flower in pattern insert r needle into third st down from second st on l needle draw through a loop leave on r needle k2 make another loop
